text.p: These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Thursday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Catholic Bishops meeting in Luanda issued a letter urging, among other things, that the government pay salary backlogs to civil servants who have not been paid since November 1996. they also brought attention to the growing gap between wages and the cost of living.
- The U.S. embassy in Luanda congratulated the government on the establishment of the unity government but it was only a step in the peace process and not the end of it.
